main.docTitle: Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Import and Export (Carriage of Articles) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: prescribed article (訂明物品) means an article of a description set out in the Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Articles prescribed for purposes of section 6E of the Ordinance
section.content: The articles in the Schedule are prescribed for the purposes of section 6E of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on application, issue a carriage licence for the purposes of section 6E of the Ordinance authorizing the carriage of a prescribed article within the waters of Hong Kong and any ancillary land transportation subject to such conditions, restrictions, requirements and directions as the Commissioner may think fit.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subregulation (1), the owner of a prescribed article shall apply for a carriage licence in writing specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name, address and occupation or business of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the article to be carried, including identifying numbers and description;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: details of the carrying vessel and of the proposed voyage;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the article is intended for export and details of any clearances obtained to enable importation at the destination; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other particulars that the Commissioner may reasonably require to ascertain the bona fides of the shipping arrangements and to identify the applicant, the article, the vessel, transportation arrangements, including any land element of the transportation, and any other persons involved in the transportation of the article.

subsection.content: A person who breaches the terms of a carriage licence issued by the Commissioner under subregulation (1) is guilty of an offence and liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the discretion of the Commissioner to impose conditions in a carriage licence issued by him under subregulation (1), the Commissioner may impose conditions relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time and method of carriage of the articles, including restrictions on the land element of the transportation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the place of loading and unloading from the vessel;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number and description of the articles covered by the carriage licence; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the vessel on or by which the articles may be carried.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Carriage licence to accompany prescribed article

subsection.content: A person who is in possession of a prescribed article while it is being carried in accordance with the terms of a carriage licence issued by the Commissioner under regulation 4(1) shall carry the carriage licence with the prescribed article. (L.N. 135 of 1994)

A person who is in possession of a prescribed article while it is being carried in accordance with the terms of a carriage licence issued by the Commissioner under regulation 4(1) shall produce the carriage licence on demand to any police officer or member of the Customs and Excise Service or an authorized officer. (L.N. 135 of 1994)
A person who contravenes subregulation (1) or (2) is guilty of an offence and liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
